actual_observations.observation: For the past few weeks, Emily has been feeling unusually thirsty all the time, no matter how much she drinks.
Emily reports needing to urinate more frequently, especially during the night.
Emily feels constantly tired, even though sheâ€™s getting enough sleep.
Emily's vision has been blurry on and off.
Emily is experiencing menopause, with symptoms including hot flashes and mood swings.
Emily has been diagnosed with hypertension and is managing it with medication.
Based on her symptoms of increased thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, and blurred vision, Emily is suspected to have Type 2 Diabetes and requires a blood test for confirmation.
Emily takes Lisinopril, 10 mg, once daily to manage her hypertension.
Emily applies an Estradiol Patch, 0.05 mg/day, twice a week for hormonal replacement during menopause.
Emily works a desk job and spends most of her day sitting, contributing to her sedentary lifestyle.
Emily frequently eats fast food and snacks on sugary treats.
Emily experiences sleep disturbances and has irregular sleep patterns due to menopausal symptoms.
Emily makes a consistent effort to walk briskly for 30 minutes five days a week.
